info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 2 at 4:16PM CDT until May 2 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
FFWSHV
The National Weather Service in Shreveport has extended the
* Flash Flood Warning for... Central Ouachita Parish in north central Louisiana... Southeastern Union Parish in north central Louisiana...
* Until 630 PM CDT.
* At 416 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing and will continue as more storms move into the area.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Monroe, Claiborne, West Monroe, Brownsville-Bawcom, Brownsville-Bawcomville, Swartz, Richwood, Drew, Cheniere, Folksville, Rocky Branch, Loch Lomon, Eureka, Calhoun, Mineral Springs, Caderville and Pine Grove.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
